meanings.definition: A sudden, complete, or marked change in something
meanings.sent1: The industrial revolution brought about many changes in society.
meanings.sent2: The revolutions in technology have transformed the way we live.
meanings.sent3: The classroom was in a state of revolution when the teacher introduced a new game.
meanings.sent4: Her innovative ideas sparked a revolution in the fashion industry.
meanings.sent5: The revolution in healthcare improved the quality of life for many people.

meanings.definition: A single complete turn of something around an axis
meanings.sent1: The Earth completes multiple revolutions around the sun each year.
meanings.sent2: The wheel made one full revolution before coming to a stop.
meanings.sent3: The record player's needle made a satisfying click at the end of its revolution.
meanings.sent4: The gymnast's flawless routine included a perfect revolution in mid-air.
meanings.sent5: The clock's second hand made a swift revolution around its face.

meanings.definition: The movement of an object in a circular or elliptical course around another or about an axis or center
meanings.sent1: The moon's revolution around the Earth creates the lunar phases.
meanings.sent2: The planets' revolutions around the sun follow predictable paths.
meanings.sent3: The toy car's revolution around the track delighted the children.
meanings.sent4: The dancer's graceful revolution on stage captivated the audience.
meanings.sent5: The merry-go-round's constant revolution brought joy to the children at the park.
